Netscape Browser Certificate Information

31 Dec 1999

\nAs you may know, Verisign security certificates included in some older Netscape browser\nversions will soon expire. The ability of consumers with older browsers to have continued\nsmooth and safe online transaction experiences may be affected by the expiration of these\nVerisign certificates. Although consumers will be able to continue to make secure\ntransactions, they will see an expiration dialog box whenever they try to access secure\nsites. Please note that this Verisign certificate expiration is a normal occurrence -\nsimilar to that of a driver's license, which periodically expires. \n

\n

\nThe purpose of this message is to: \n

    \n
  • 1. Let you know which older versions of Netscape browsers include the expiring Verisign\ncertificates. \n
  • 2. Provide information on easy options for your customers to upgrade their browser. \n
  • 3. Provide you with access to a 'Toolkit' (below) to help you identify affected customers\nand communicate with them successfully. \n
\n

\n

\n1. Netscape Products Which Are Affected and Are Not Affected: \nVersions 4.05 and earlier of Netscape Navigator and Communicator with VeriSign\ncertificates are pre-set to expire after December 31, 1999 and need to be updated.. Newer\nversions of Netscape Communicator are NOT affected and DO NOT need to be updated. They\nare: version 4.06 (released in August 1998), 4.07, 4.08, 4.5, 4.51, 4.6, 4.61 and the\ncurrent version 4.7. People using version 4.06 and later do not need to upgrade to\nversion 4.7, although they are encouraged to do so as part of overall good browser\npractices. \n

\n

\n2. Easy options for end users to upgrade to Netscape Communicator 4.7: \nAs part of the Toolkit provided with this message, you should highlight to your affected\ncustomers: \n- Free Download of Netscape Communicator 4.7 is at: \nhttp://dms-www1.netscape.com/cgi-bin/gx.cgi/mcp?p=63C0W03C0c51rrWd01200WB0mhL\n- CD-ROM's of Netscape Communicator 4.7 are available for a small shipping and handling\nfee at: http://dms-www1.netscape.com/cgi-bin/gx.cgi/mcp?p=63C0X03C0c51rrWd01200WB0mhL\n

\n

\n3. Simple Toolkit to Help You Identify and Communicate with Affected Customers (see\nInformation Link): \n- Javascript code with a 'sniffer' tool that you can place on your site that \ndetermines if someone using an older Netscape browser has arrived at your secure website. \n- A graphic image (pop-up size) that you may wish to serve up to users of the older\nproducts. You may edit this graphic or substitute one of your own. GIF image provided\nbelow. \n- Information Link: customers interested in more information can go to Netscape's\nconsumer FAQ at:\nhttp://dms-www1.netscape.com/cgi-bin/gx.cgi/mcp?p=63C0Y03C0c51rrWd01200WB0mhL\n- Contact Info: if your company has additional questions, please contact us at\ndigitalcert@netscape.com

If you require additional information on the server side issues surrounding the expiration\nof Verisign Certificates, please visit the iPlanet web site \nhttp://dms-www1.netscape.com/cgi-bin/gx.cgi/mcp?p=63C0Z03C0c51rrWd01200WB0mhL for the\nlatest news and information. \n

\n

Note: This information was provided by an official Netscape source, not myself. Could someone with knowledge please post the corresponding info for IE browsers?

\n
